latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 302.

item.title: Point Reyes Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

summary.text:
Point Reyes Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

This bill directs the Coast Guard to convey 32 acres of federal land (including all buildings, structures, utilities, and facilities on the land) known as CAMSPAC Housing in Point Reyes Station to Marin County, California, to be used for affordable housing or to provide a public benefit approved by the County.

The property must be sold at fair market value.

The Coast Guard may deposit the proceeds in the Coast Guard Housing Fund.

The Coast Guard's authority to convey the property expires after four years.

bill.title: Point Reyes Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

item.title: Point Reyes Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act
A bill to direct the Commandant of the Coast Guard to convey certain property from the United States to the County of Marin, California.
Point Reyes Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
